6c2842c3-0165-4cbf-b1ea-5a1ee208538d.description: To introduce the risk management phases and to apply them directly to an IT project. Major topics covered in the course are risk management planning, risk identification, risk analysis (including decision trees and PERT), risk prioritization, risk assessment, risk response development, risk evaluation, risk documentation, and risk response control (including establishing lines of responsibility, and planning responses based on risk level and documentation).
6c2842c3-0165-4cbf-b1ea-5a1ee208538d.name: IT Risk Management (e-training) (ITR520) (v.1)

issuer.summary: issued by Korn Ferry (formerly TwentyEighty Strategy Execution)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment are quizzes, examinations, case studies, discussions, activity debriefs, and action plan debriefs.
Methods of instruction include lecture, case studies, exercises, teamwork, discussion, and final examination.

e61828b5-4352-4d78-8da7-d1390ebfba9e.description: To present project management concepts, tools, and techniques needed to meet the specific needs of IT projects: covered are all phases of the IT project life cycle-concept, requirements, planning, design, construction, delivery, and closeout.
e61828b5-4352-4d78-8da7-d1390ebfba9e.name: Managing IT Projects (e-Training) (MIT520) (v.2)

issuer.summary: issued by Korn Ferry (formerly TwentyEighty Strategy Execution)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment are quizzes, examinations, case studies, discussions, activity debriefs, and action plan debriefs.

Methods of instruction include self-paced interactive lessons in which participants attempt to solve one or more problems using provided resources; exercises in which participants practice the information and skills gained; reading assignments that reinforce and expand on lesson content; written assignments in which participants apply the information and skills to a specific project with personalized feedback from the course instructor; class discussions using an on-line threaded discussion tool

fe24d87f-cc71-453d-adb2-1de73d885123.description: To give a practical introduction to negotiation strategies and techniques, while helping students recognize their own competencies and incompetencies and those of others.Major topics covered in course are negotiations techniques, preparing for a negotiation, using techniques to influence the other party, conducting the negotiations, and applying individual style/competencies to the negotiation process.
fe24d87f-cc71-453d-adb2-1de73d885123.name: Negotiation Strategies and Techniques (BRR-3) (v.3)

issuer.summary: issued by Korn Ferry (formerly TwentyEighty Strategy Execution)

badge_template_activities.title: Methods of instruction include lecture, mock negotiation case studies, videotape performance analysis, diagnostic testing, teamwork, discussion, and final examination.

e04849ae-62f5-4645-abe3-1cdd9b6e7a99.description: The course objective is to give the participants the opportunity to select a project for agile development; determine the readiness of the organization, team, customer and project manager; and work through the life cycle of an Agile project. The general course topics include introduction to agile project management, traditional approach versus agile approach, developing the agile environment, envisioning the agile project, building an iteration, and managing iteration changes.
e04849ae-62f5-4645-abe3-1cdd9b6e7a99.name: Agile Projects: Keys to Getting Started (D77)

issuer.summary: issued by Korn Ferry (formerly TwentyEighty Strategy Execution)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, practical exercises, lecture, discussion, and classroom exercise.

17c60b03-f4fb-4ea1-92a4-d6b6d5d4ba1a.description: The course objective is to explore all phases of contracting from requirements development to closeout from the manager's perspective, highlighting key roles and responsibilities to give greater influence over how work is performed. Participants also discuss actions that can be taken to help ensure that contractors or subcontractors perform as required under the contract.
17c60b03-f4fb-4ea1-92a4-d6b6d5d4ba1a.name: Contract Management Principles and Practices (DF3, DF3v)

issuer.summary: issued by Korn Ferry (formerly TwentyEighty Strategy Execution)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, classroom exercises, discussion, lecture, and practical exercises. The general course topics include the contract management process, contracting methods and contract types, the pre-award phase, the award phase, and the post-award phase.

719d4d46-a4c1-44f2-932f-5f5445cfc5f0.description: This course objective is to provide a structured approach for tackling problems, opportunities, and decisions that will ultimately help you get better results whether you are innovating, managing crises, or planning for the future. The course addresses the five types of critical thinking needed in business environments: strategic thinking, tactical thinking, analytical thinking, innovative thinking, and implicative thinking.
719d4d46-a4c1-44f2-932f-5f5445cfc5f0.name: Critical Thinking and Problem Solving (DFN, DFNv)

issuer.summary: issued by Korn Ferry (formerly TwentyEighty Strategy Execution)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include action plans with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, practical exercises, lecture, discussion, and classroom exercises. The general course topics include the critical thinking model; problem/opportunity identification and analysis; environmental scan; response exploration; response selection; response implementation; and putting it to work.

47bee7f9-7cb5-4f33-b3a9-d3fbf2bd41ca.description: The course objective is to look at the processes around solution scope validation, collaborative elicitation, modeling the solution, documenting effective requirements, solution validation, requirements change management, and how to plan the work necessary to successfully drive the whole process.
47bee7f9-7cb5-4f33-b3a9-d3fbf2bd41ca.name: Eliciting and Managing Requirements (GSR, GSRv)

issuer.summary: issued by Korn Ferry (formerly TwentyEighty Strategy Execution)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, practical exercises, lecture, discussion, and classroom exercise. The general course topics include validating understanding of the solution scope, collaborative elicitation and analysis, modeling the solution, documenting and communicating good requirements, validating requirement, controlling requirements, and business analysis planning.

03b371cb-d28d-48e5-b29b-e334503ca486.description: The course objective is to start the introduction to government contracting, giving the basic information needed to understand procurement from start to finish, from acquisition planning through contract closeout. Participants will receive the primary tools and guidance needed to fulfill key responsibilities and contribute to the success of the contracting projects in which they are involved.
03b371cb-d28d-48e5-b29b-e334503ca486.name: Federal Contracting Basics (BLQ, BLQv)

issuer.summary: issued by Korn Ferry (formerly TwentyEighty Strategy Execution)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, classroom exercises, discussion, lecture, and practical exercises. The general course topics include the introduction to the federal marketplace, contracting: roles and responsibilities, introduction to the FAR, overview of the federal contracting process, key contracting policies, acquisition planning, contract structure and content, contract formation policies and processes, and contract administration policies and processes.

4c59f637-229a-4e67-bc86-6da41dd8908a.description: The course objective is to build a foundation that looks at the whole organization and how business analysis is applied in articulating and prioritizing business needs, identifying and assessing solution options, making recommendations, defining solution scope, requirements management within a project, supporting a solution once it is in place, making sure the business objectives are met, and continuously improving the solution to increase its business value.
4c59f637-229a-4e67-bc86-6da41dd8908a.name: Fundamentals of Business Analysis (GSQ, GSQv)

issuer.summary: issued by Korn Ferry (formerly TwentyEighty Strategy Execution)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, practical exercises, lecture, discussion, and classroom exercise. The general course topics include basics of business analysis, business need and solution definition, requirements management, benefits management, and enterprise analysis.

780596cc-e386-42ee-9bc7-d7a76e82dcf1.description: The course objective is to teach techniques for creating high-impact, meaningful communication with coworkers, clients, and stakeholders. Through practical exercises, group discussions and case studies, students will learn how to determine their own communication style, identify the communication styles of their audience and adapt their delivery accordingly.
780596cc-e386-42ee-9bc7-d7a76e82dcf1.name: High-Impact Communication (DFM, DFMv)

issuer.summary: issued by Korn Ferry (formerly TwentyEighty Strategy Execution)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include presentations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, practical exercises, lecture, discussion, and classroom exercise. The general course topics include communication intelligence, planning messages, message structure, message delivery, and high-impact meetings.

f52051ea-3043-4be6-b3be-b98d5b041ef6.description: The course objective is to learn to look at IT risk management as a way to seize opportunities, minimize threats and achieve optimum results. Participants work through the proactive approach to threat and opportunity based on a clear understanding of the powerful nature of both qualitative and quantitative approaches to risk management.
f52051ea-3043-4be6-b3be-b98d5b041ef6.name: IT Risk Management (DBP, DBPv)

issuer.summary: issued by Korn Ferry (formerly TwentyEighty Strategy Execution)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, practical exercises, lecture, discussion, and classroom exercises. The general course topics include foundations of risk, identifying risk analysis fundamentals, analyzing and prioritizing risks, planning responses to risk, risk execution, and risk evaluation.

40688c6a-aef2-4ad8-9630-a79cbf5ad447.description: The course objective is to discover critical success factors and hidden risks inherent in IT projects and to understand strategies and techniques developed in the field by experienced IT project managers for successfully managing IT projects. The general course topics include an overview of IT project management, concept phase, requirements phase, planning phase, design phase, construction phase, and delivery phase.
40688c6a-aef2-4ad8-9630-a79cbf5ad447.name: Managing IT Projects (DBR, DBRv)

issuer.summary: issued by Korn Ferry (formerly TwentyEighty Strategy Execution)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, practical exercises, lecture, discussion, and classroom exercises.

7a4d7bd6-61cf-4a15-b603-81a005afd0c5.description: The course objective is to provide foundations, techniques, and tools to manage each stage of the project life cycle; work within organizational and cost constraints; set goals tied directly to stakeholder needs; get the most from a project management team; and utilize state-of-the-art project management tools to get the work done on time and within budget.
7a4d7bd6-61cf-4a15-b603-81a005afd0c5.name: Managing Projects (CPM, CPMv)

issuer.summary: issued by Korn Ferry (formerly TwentyEighty Strategy Execution)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, classroom exercises, discussion, lecture, and practical exercises. The general course topics include introduction to project management, project initiation, project planning, project implementation, and project closeout.

90a6101c-1395-4f4d-83e0-8e5a8c3773ed.description: The course objective is to provide a solid foundation in key leadership competencies and to afford participants the opportunity for a truly transformational leadership experience. Students will complete a self-assessment of their leadership skills and then master the basics of these leadership competencies: setting direction, aligning people, motivating and inspiring, leading teams, communicating, building relationships, facilitating ethical conduct, and negotiating and leading change.
90a6101c-1395-4f4d-83e0-8e5a8c3773ed.name: Project Leadership, Management, and Communications (DBQ, DBQv)

issuer.summary: issued by Korn Ferry (formerly TwentyEighty Strategy Execution)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include case studies, presentations, and performance rubrics with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, case studies, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, discussion, and classroom exercise. The general course topics include leadership and management, leading effective teams, building relationships, ethics and leadership, negotiating conflict, and leading change.

2cd296e2-65fe-4ba2-b8b8-d6e6e45e7e60.description: The course objective is to propose, plan and execute a full-scale project under typical organizational constraints. Following a project through the life cycle, resolving issues of performance, and scheduling and control while addressing questions of leadership and management.
2cd296e2-65fe-4ba2-b8b8-d6e6e45e7e60.name: Project Management Applications (BTP)

issuer.summary: issued by Korn Ferry (formerly TwentyEighty Strategy Execution)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include written papers with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, lecture, discussion, learner presentations, practical exercises, and classroom exercises. The general course topics include team building, preproposal analysis and planning, proposal kickoff and preparation, post award planning, negotiation/agreement, implementation, and closeout modality.

8d21088f-f21c-4340-8b43-6e3ef8689f7a.description: The course objective is to learn about the philosophy and principles of quality management and learn how to translate these concepts into specific actions that are key to successful project quality efforts. The course presents a five-step model for successfully planning project quality, a five-step model for effectively assuring project quality, and a quality-control toolkit, all of which you can immediately apply to your work environment.
8d21088f-f21c-4340-8b43-6e3ef8689f7a.name: Quality for Project Managers (CTM, CTMv)

issuer.summary: issued by Korn Ferry (formerly TwentyEighty Strategy Execution)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, practical exercises, lecture, discussion, and classroom exercise. The general course topics include quality management principles in the project environment, quality planning, quality assurance, and quality control.

d66633c4-897a-400e-b9af-f02200d9c642.description: The course objective is to work through the proactive approach to threat and opportunity based on a clear understanding of the powerful nature of both qualitative and quantitative approaches to risk management. The general course topics include introduction to risk, risk management planning and identifying risks, analysis fundamentals, analyzing and prioritizing risk, risk response planning, execution, evaluation, and update.
d66633c4-897a-400e-b9af-f02200d9c642.name: Risk Management (CTL, CTLv)

issuer.summary: issued by Korn Ferry (formerly TwentyEighty Strategy Execution)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, classroom exercises, discussion, lecture, and practical exercises.

7796514c-c982-4876-b6bb-302e14c4f40d.description: The course objective is to develop effective measures for scheduling and controlling projects as participants put the tools of project management to work. In this course, participants will focus on managing the constraints faced in any project: limits on time, human resources, materials, budget and specifications.
7796514c-c982-4876-b6bb-302e14c4f40d.name: Scheduling and Cost Control (BVZ, BVZv)

issuer.summary: issued by Korn Ferry (formerly TwentyEighty Strategy Execution)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, classroom exercises, discussion, lecture, and practical exercises. The general course topics include essential background, the work breakdown structure- a review, identifying controllable costs, building the project resource pool, scheduling, the baseline, managing change within the project, evaluation and forecasting, and exit strategy.

5171682a-3a9c-40e4-ae9e-81d846dcaade.description: The course objective is to provide participants with a solid understanding of what the rules mean and skill training on the principles and processes of sound business decision analysis and decision making. This course offers industry professionals a wealth of insight into the source selection process and the tools to use those insights to develop effective, winning proposals.
5171682a-3a9c-40e4-ae9e-81d846dcaade.name: Source Selection: The Best-Value Process (BWM, BWMv)

issuer.summary: issued by Korn Ferry (formerly TwentyEighty Strategy Execution)
